comments.html:
Or they googled it ;) Here's the first hit I got:

https://community.cisco.com/t5/routing/can-any-one-tell-me-what-is-eibgp-and-what-is-it-stands-for/td-p/2469862

And the second one explains it:

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_bgp/configuration/15-mt/irg-15-mt-book/irg-eibgp-multipath-for-nonvrf-interfaces.pdf

It's (somewhat complex) multipathing between EBGP and IBGP paths.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Funny - this article is more than a month old, but nobody asked what this EIBGP is supposed to be. I assume you meant EIGRP…
comments.name: Arne
